storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to create shift templates to achieve standardized scheduling

testCases.title: Validate successful shift template creation with valid input
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access permissions to create shift templates
Shift template management module is accessible
Database connection to ShiftTemplates table is active
No existing template with the same name exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to shift template creation page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Shift template form is displayed with all required fields: template name, category, start time, end time, breaks section, and roles assignment section

steps.action: Enter template name as 'Morning Shift - Weekday'
steps.expectedResult: Template name field accepts the input and displays the entered text

steps.action: Select category as 'Standard Shifts' from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Category dropdown displays selected value 'Standard Shifts'

steps.action: Enter valid start time as '09:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Start time field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Enter valid end time as '05:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: End time field accepts the input and validates that end time is after start time

steps.action: Add first break period: Start time '12:00 PM', End time '12:30 PM', Break type 'Lunch'
steps.expectedResult: Break is added to the breaks list with no validation errors

steps.action: Add second break period: Start time '03:00 PM', End time '03:15 PM', Break type 'Rest'
steps.expectedResult: Second break is added to the breaks list with no overlap validation errors

steps.action: Assign roles 'Customer Service Representative' and 'Team Lead' from the roles dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected roles are displayed in the assigned roles section

steps.action: Click the 'Save Template' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs, processes the request within 2 seconds, and displays success confirmation message 'Shift template created successfully'

steps.action: Verify the newly created template appears in the shift templates list
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Morning Shift - Weekday' is visible in the templates list with all entered details

postconditions: Shift template is saved in ShiftTemplates table with unique ID
Template is available for future retrieval and use
Audit trail entry is created with HR Manager username and timestamp
User remains on the shift template management page or is redirected to templates list
System is ready to accept new template creation requests

testCases.title: Reject shift template creation with overlapping breaks
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access permissions to create shift templates
Shift template creation page is accessible
Validation rules for overlapping breaks are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to shift template creation page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Shift template form is displayed with all required input fields

steps.action: Enter template name as 'Test Overlapping Breaks'
steps.expectedResult: Template name field accepts the input

steps.action: Enter valid start time as '08:00 AM' and end time as '04:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Time fields accept the input without errors

steps.action: Add first break period: Start time '11:00 AM', End time '11:30 AM'
steps.expectedResult: First break is added successfully to the breaks list

steps.action: Add second break period with overlapping time: Start time '11:15 AM', End time '11:45 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed: 'Break periods cannot overlap. Please adjust the break times.' The overlapping break is highlighted in red

steps.action: Add third break period with complete overlap: Start time '11:00 AM', End time '11:30 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed: 'This break period overlaps with an existing break.' Error indicator appears next to the break field

steps.action: Assign role 'Supervisor' from the roles dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Role is assigned successfully despite break validation errors

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking 'Save Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked. Error summary is displayed at the top: 'Cannot save template. Please correct the following errors: Overlapping break periods detected.' Save button remains disabled or shows error state

steps.action: Verify that no API call is made to POST /api/shifttemplates
steps.expectedResult: No network request is sent to the backend. Client-side validation prevents submission

postconditions: No shift template is created in the database
User remains on the shift template creation page with error messages visible
All entered data (except invalid breaks) is retained in the form
No audit trail entry is created
System is ready to accept corrected input

testCases.title: Ensure audit trail records template creation
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with username 'hr.manager@company.com'
User has permissions to create shift templates
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
User has access to query audit trail logs or audit trail viewing interface
System timestamp is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to shift template creation page
steps.expectedResult: Shift template creation form is displayed

steps.action: Enter template name as 'Evening Shift - Audit Test'
steps.expectedResult: Template name is accepted

steps.action: Enter start time '02:00 PM' and end time '10:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Time fields accept valid input

steps.action: Add break period: Start time '05:00 PM', End time '05:30 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Break is added without validation errors

steps.action: Assign role 'Sales Associate'
steps.expectedResult: Role is assigned successfully

steps.action: Select category as 'Evening Shifts'
steps.expectedResult: Category is selected

steps.action: Note the current system timestamp before submission
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for verification (e.g., 2024-01-15 14:30:00)

steps.action: Click 'Save Template' button
steps.expectedResult: Template is saved successfully and confirmation message 'Shift template created successfully' is displayed. Note the template ID from the confirmation or URL

steps.action: Navigate to audit trail logs interface or query the audit database for recent entries
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail interface is accessible and displays recent audit entries

steps.action: Filter audit logs by action type 'Template Creation' or entity type 'ShiftTemplate' for the noted timestamp range
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entries are filtered and displayed

steps.action: Locate the audit entry for template 'Evening Shift - Audit Test'
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry exists with the following details: Action: 'CREATE', Entity: 'ShiftTemplate', Entity ID: [template ID], User: 'hr.manager@company.com', Timestamp: [within 1 second of noted time], Details: Template name and key attributes

steps.action: Verify audit entry contains complete information including user identity and accurate timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry shows complete trail with username 'hr.manager@company.com', accurate timestamp matching creation time, and all relevant template details

postconditions: Shift template 'Evening Shift - Audit Test' exists in the database
Audit trail entry is permanently recorded in audit logs
Audit entry is retrievable for compliance and tracking purposes
System maintains data integrity between template and audit records
User can view audit history for the created template

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to edit existing shift templates to maintain accurate scheduling standards

testCases.title: Validate successful shift template editing with versioning
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with valid credentials
User has role-based permissions to edit shift templates
At least one existing shift template 'Morning Shift - Standard' exists in the system with version 1.0
Existing template has: Start time '08:00 AM', End time '04:00 PM', Break '12:00 PM - 12:30 PM', Role 'Agent'
Version control system is enabled for shift templates
Database connection to ShiftTemplates table with versioning is active

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list page from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: List of existing shift templates is displayed in a table or grid format showing template names, categories, current version, and last modified date

steps.action: Locate the template 'Morning Shift - Standard' in the list
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Morning Shift - Standard' is visible with current version displayed as 'v1.0'

steps.action: Click on the 'Edit' button or icon next to the template
steps.expectedResult: Template edit form opens with all current values pre-populated: Start time '08:00 AM', End time '04:00 PM', Break '12:00 PM - 12:30 PM', Role 'Agent'

steps.action: Modify the start time from '08:00 AM' to '09:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Start time field updates to show '09:00 AM' without validation errors

steps.action: Modify the end time from '04:00 PM' to '05:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: End time field updates to show '05:00 PM' and validates that end time is after start time

steps.action: Edit the existing break period from '12:00 PM - 12:30 PM' to '12:30 PM - 01:00 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Break period is updated successfully with no overlap validation errors

steps.action: Add an additional role 'Senior Agent' to the existing role assignment
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Senior Agent' is added to the roles list alongside existing 'Agent' role

steps.action: Enter version notes or change description as 'Updated shift timing and added senior agent role'
steps.expectedResult: Version notes field accepts the input

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates all inputs, processes the update request, and displays confirmation message 'Shift template updated successfully. New version v2.0 created.'

steps.action: Navigate back to the shift template list
steps.expectedResult: Template 'Morning Shift - Standard' now shows version 'v2.0' with updated last modified date

steps.action: Click on 'View Version History' or similar option for the template
steps.expectedResult: Version history displays both v1.0 and v2.0 with timestamps, user who made changes, and change descriptions. v1.0 shows original values and v2.0 shows updated values

steps.action: Verify that previous version v1.0 is still accessible and preserved
steps.expectedResult: Version v1.0 can be viewed with all original values intact: Start '08:00 AM', End '04:00 PM', Break '12:00 PM - 12:30 PM', Role 'Agent'

postconditions: New version v2.0 of the shift template is saved in the database
Previous version v1.0 is preserved and accessible in version history
Template list displays the latest version v2.0 as the active version
Audit trail entry is created for the edit action with Scheduler username and timestamp
Updated template is available for scheduling operations
Version history is complete and accurate for compliance tracking

testCases.title: Reject edits with invalid break overlaps
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with edit permissions
Existing shift template 'Afternoon Shift' exists with: Start '01:00 PM', End '09:00 PM', Break '04:00 PM - 04:30 PM'
Template is at version v1.0
Validation rules for overlapping breaks are active

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list page
steps.expectedResult: List of shift templates is displayed including 'Afternoon Shift'

steps.action: Select template 'Afternoon Shift' and click 'Edit'
steps.expectedResult: Edit form opens with pre-populated values: Start '01:00 PM', End '09:00 PM', existing break '04:00 PM - 04:30 PM'

steps.action: Click 'Add Break' to add a second break period
steps.expectedResult: New break input fields are displayed for start and end time

steps.action: Enter second break with overlapping time: Start '04:15 PM', End '04:45 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears: 'Break periods cannot overlap. The new break overlaps with existing break (04:00 PM - 04:30 PM).' Error is highlighted in red next to the break field

steps.action: Verify that error indicator shows which breaks are conflicting
steps.expectedResult: Both the existing break '04:00 PM - 04:30 PM' and new break '04:15 PM - 04:45 PM' are highlighted or marked with error indicators showing the overlap conflict

steps.action: Attempt to add another break with complete overlap: Start '04:00 PM', End '04:30 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error displays: 'This break period exactly matches an existing break. Please use different times.' Duplicate break is marked with error

steps.action: Modify shift end time to '10:00 PM' while overlapping breaks still exist
steps.expectedResult: End time is updated but break overlap errors remain visible

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button while validation errors are present
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked. Error summary appears at top of form: 'Cannot save changes. Please resolve the following errors: Break periods overlap detected.' Save button is disabled or shows error state

steps.action: Verify no API call is made to PUT /api/shifttemplates/{id}
steps.expectedResult: No network request is sent to backend. Client-side validation prevents submission

steps.action: Correct the overlapping break by changing second break to '05:00 PM - 05:30 PM'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error clears. Break fields show no error indicators. Save button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' after correcting errors
steps.expectedResult: Template is saved successfully with new version created. Confirmation message displays: 'Shift template updated successfully'

postconditions: No invalid template version is created during error state
After correction, new valid version is saved with non-overlapping breaks
Original version remains unchanged until valid edits are saved
Audit trail shows only the successful save operation, not the blocked attempts
User remains on edit page during error state, redirected to list after successful save

testCases.title: Verify audit trail records template edits
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler with username 'scheduler@company.com'
User has permissions to edit shift templates and view audit logs
Existing shift template 'Night Shift - Audit Test' exists at version v1.0
Existing template details: Start '10:00 PM', End '06:00 AM', Break '02:00 AM - 02:30 AM', Role 'Night Supervisor'
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
System timestamp is accurate and synchronized

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list page
steps.expectedResult: Shift templates list is displayed showing 'Night Shift - Audit Test' at version v1.0

steps.action: Note the current system timestamp before making edits
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for audit verification (e.g., 2024-01-15 16:45:00)

steps.action: Select 'Night Shift - Audit Test' and click 'Edit'
steps.expectedResult: Edit form opens with current values pre-populated

steps.action: Change the break period from '02:00 AM - 02:30 AM' to '01:30 AM - 02:00 AM'
steps.expectedResult: Break time is updated without validation errors

steps.action: Add additional role 'Security Officer' to the template
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Security Officer' is added alongside 'Night Supervisor'

steps.action: Enter version notes as 'Adjusted break time and added security officer role'
steps.expectedResult: Version notes are accepted

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: Edit is saved successfully. Confirmation message displays: 'Shift template updated successfully. New version v2.0 created.' Note the template ID and new version number

steps.action: Navigate to audit trail logs interface or access audit log query tool
steps.expectedResult: Audit trail interface is accessible and displays recent audit entries

steps.action: Filter audit logs by action type 'Template Edit' or 'UPDATE' for entity type 'ShiftTemplate' within the timestamp range
steps.expectedResult: Filtered audit entries are displayed for template modifications

steps.action: Locate the audit entry for 'Night Shift - Audit Test' edit operation
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry exists with following details: Action: 'UPDATE', Entity: 'ShiftTemplate', Entity ID: [template ID], User: 'scheduler@company.com', Timestamp: [within 1 second of save time], Previous Version: 'v1.0', New Version: 'v2.0'

steps.action: Verify audit entry contains detailed change information
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry shows: Changed fields: 'break_period' (from '02:00 AM - 02:30 AM' to '01:30 AM - 02:00 AM'), 'roles' (added 'Security Officer'), Version notes: 'Adjusted break time and added security officer role'

steps.action: Verify audit entry includes complete user identification and timestamp accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Audit record displays: User: 'scheduler@company.com', User role: 'Scheduler', Timestamp matches save operation time, IP address or session ID is logged for security tracking

steps.action: Check that audit entry is immutable and permanently stored
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry cannot be edited or deleted. Entry is marked as permanent record for compliance purposes

postconditions: Shift template 'Night Shift - Audit Test' exists at version v2.0 with updated values
Version v1.0 is preserved in version history
Audit trail entry is permanently recorded with complete edit details
Audit log is retrievable for compliance, security, and tracking purposes
System maintains referential integrity between template versions and audit records
Complete change history is available for the template showing who changed what and when

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to categorize shift templates by department to improve template organization

testCases.title: Create and assign categories to shift templates
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with appropriate permissions
Shift template management interface is accessible
At least one shift template exists in the system
Categories table is accessible and functional

steps.action: Navigate to shift template management section
steps.expectedResult: Shift template management page loads successfully with list of existing templates

steps.action: Click on 'Manage Categories' or 'Create Category' button
steps.expectedResult: Category creation form or modal opens

steps.action: Enter a unique category name (e.g., 'Sales Department') in the category name field
steps.expectedResult: Category name is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create' button to save the new category
steps.expectedResult: Category is saved successfully, success message is displayed, and category appears in the categories list

steps.action: Select an existing shift template from the template list
steps.expectedResult: Template details page or edit form opens

steps.action: Locate the category assignment section in the template form
steps.expectedResult: Category selection dropdown or multi-select field is visible with available categories including the newly created 'Sales Department'

steps.action: Select 'Sales Department' category from the available options
steps.expectedResult: Category is selected and displayed as assigned to the template

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the template with assigned category
steps.expectedResult: Template is saved successfully with the assigned category, confirmation message is displayed, and category is visible in template details

postconditions: New category 'Sales Department' exists in the system
Selected shift template has 'Sales Department' category assigned
Category is visible in template list view
Changes are persisted in the database

testCases.title: Filter shift templates by category
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with appropriate permissions
Multiple shift templates exist in the system
At least two different categories exist (e.g., 'Sales Department', 'IT Department')
Templates are assigned to different categories
At least 2 templates are assigned to 'Sales Department' category

steps.action: Navigate to shift template management page
steps.expectedResult: Template management page loads with all available templates displayed in the list

steps.action: Locate the category filter dropdown or filter section in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Category filter control is visible and displays all available categories

steps.action: Click on the category filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing list of all categories including 'Sales Department' and 'IT Department'

steps.action: Select 'Sales Department' from the category filter options
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied immediately, template list updates to show only templates assigned to 'Sales Department' category, templates from other categories are hidden

steps.action: Verify the filtered results by checking each displayed template
steps.expectedResult: All displayed templates show 'Sales Department' as their assigned category, template count reflects only filtered results

steps.action: Clear the filter or select 'All Categories' option
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed and all templates are displayed again in the list

postconditions: Template list can be filtered and unfiltered without errors
Filter state can be cleared to show all templates
No data is modified during filtering operation

testCases.title: Prevent duplicate category names
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with appropriate permissions
Category management interface is accessible
A category named 'Sales Department' already exists in the system
Category validation rules are active

steps.action: Navigate to shift template management section
steps.expectedResult: Shift template management page loads successfully

steps.action: Click on 'Manage Categories' or 'Create Category' button
steps.expectedResult: Category creation form or modal opens

steps.action: Enter an existing category name 'Sales Department' in the category name field
steps.expectedResult: Category name is entered in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create' button to attempt saving the duplicate category
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating 'Category name already exists' or similar message, category is not saved, form remains open with entered data

steps.action: Verify that the duplicate category was not created by checking the categories list
steps.expectedResult: Only one instance of 'Sales Department' exists in the categories list, no duplicate entry is present

steps.action: Modify the category name to a unique value (e.g., 'Sales Department - East Region')
steps.expectedResult: New unique category name is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create' button
steps.expectedResult: Category is saved successfully with the unique name, success message is displayed

postconditions: No duplicate category names exist in the system
Original 'Sales Department' category remains unchanged
New unique category 'Sales Department - East Region' is created successfully
Data integrity is maintained
